gs.spri.raven

Class RavenAuthenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gs.spri.raven.RavenAuthenticator

  • public class RavenAuthenticator
extends Object
    Manages authentication against Raven, handles interaction with the Raven server, and provides the utility methods needed to parse Raven data.

    An application using this class must maintain a single instance of RavenAuthenticator for each session. Each time a request is received, the application must perform the following actions in order:

    • Call 'interceptLoginRequest()'. This method returns 'true' if the request is a redirect from Raven. In these circumstances, the application should take no further action (because a response will already have committed, typically a redirection to another URL handled by the application).
    • Optionally save request parameters in the session, if there are not already saved request parameters. If the user needs to be asked to authenticate themselves, it may take several web request/response cycles during which any POST data not saved now will be lost.
    • If the request is for a resource which the application wishes to protect using authentication, call 'handleAuthentication()'. If this method returns 'true', then the application should take no further action because a response will already have committed. Typically this will be a redirection to the Raven server. There are a variety of Exceptions that this method can throw to indicate various authentication failures. If an Exception occurs, the application should display an appropriate message and take no further action.
    • Process the request using the saved request parameters, and clear the saved request parameters from the session.
    Version:
    1.0.3, 02 January 2007
    Author:
    Matthew Lavy and Alistair Turnbull

    • Constructor Detail

      • RavenAuthenticator

        @Deprecated
public RavenAuthenticator(long clockSkew,
                             String ravenURL,
                             String interceptLoginPath,
                             String description,
                             KeyStore keys,
                             String keyPrefix)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructs a RavenAuthenticator object. This constructor is deprectated as the clockskew parameter is no longer supported by the raven authentication service.
        Parameters:
        clockSkew - tolerance in milliseconds of clock difference between the local machine and the Raven server.
        ravenURL - the URL of the Raven server. This is the URL to which users will be redirected in order to authenticate.
        interceptLoginPath - a path in the URL namespace of the (local) servlet which this RavenAuthenticator can recognise as its own. Requests to this path will be intercepted by the 'interceptLoginRequest()' method. The path must be relative to the servlet root and start with a '/'.
        description - a text description of the resource requiring authentication, or 'null'. This value is used in 'Request.desc'.
        keys - the public keys used by the Raven server to sign authentication tokens.
        keyPrefix - the common alias prefix of the Raven keys within 'keys'.

      • RavenAuthenticator

        public RavenAuthenticator(String ravenURL,
                  String interceptLoginPath,
                  String description,
                  KeyStore keys,
                  String keyPrefix)
        Constructs a RavenAuthenticator object.
        Parameters:
        ravenURL - the URL of the Raven server. This is the URL to which users will be redirected in order to authenticate.
        interceptLoginPath - a path in the URL namespace of the (local) servlet which this RavenAuthenticator can recognise as its own. Requests to this path will be intercepted by the 'interceptLoginRequest()' method. The path must be relative to the servlet root and start with a '/'.
        description - a text description of the resource requiring authentication, or 'null'. This value is used in 'Request.desc'.
        keys - the public keys used by the Raven server to sign authentication tokens.
        keyPrefix - the common alias prefix of the Raven keys within 'keys'.

    • Method Detail

      • interceptLoginRequest

        public boolean interceptLoginRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
                              throws RavenException,
                                     IOException
        This method recognises web requests that result from a redirection from the Raven server. When one is encountered, it saves all the authentication information, and redirects the client to the URL originally requested. It then returns 'true' and the caller should take no further action. For all other web requests, this method does nothing and returns 'false'.

        The test used to recognise a redirection from the Raven server is 'interceptLoginPath.equals(req.getPathInfo())' where 'interceptLoginPath' is the value that was passed to the constructor of this object.

        This method has no side-effects on 'req' if it returns 'false'.

        Parameters:
        req - the request to examine.
        res - the response to which to write the redirect instruction.
        Returns:
        'true' if the response has been written, or 'false' if the request requires further handling by the caller.
        Throws:
        RavenException - if there is a protocol error.
        IOException

      • handleAuthentication

        public boolean handleAuthentication(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res,
                           Date when,
                           String msg)
                             throws RavenException,
                                    IOException
        This method checks that the user is authenticated by examining its internal state. If so, it does nothing and returns 'false'. If the user has not yet been asked to authenticate themselves, or if the authentication Token has expired by 'when', it redirects the client to the Raven server and returns 'true'. The client should then take no further action. If the user has tried but failed to authenticate, or if authentication fails for any other reason, this method throws a RavenException.
        Parameters:
        req - the request that requires authentication.
        res - the response to which to write the redirect instruction.
        when - the date to use for the expiry check.
        msg - text describing why authentication is being requested, or 'null'. Passed to 'Request.msg'.
        Returns:
        'true' if the response has been written, or 'false' if the request requires further handling by the caller.
        Throws:
        RavenAuthenticationException - if authentication fails.
        RavenException - if there is a protocol error.
        IOException

      • isTokenCurrent

        public boolean isTokenCurrent(Date when)
        Returns 'true' if 'this.getToken()' exists and has not expired by 'when'.

      • isTokenValid

        public boolean isTokenValid()
        Returns 'true' if 'this.getToken()' exists and is valid. If you need more detail in the case where 'this.getToken()' is not valid, use 'checkTokenValid()' instead.

      • customiseRequest

        public void customiseRequest(Request rr,
                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest hsr)
        Subclasses may override this method in order to micro-manage the data sent in Raven authentication requests. It is applied to every RavenAuthenticator.Request object, immediately after its construction. The default implementation does nothing.

      • getToken

        public Token getToken()
        Returns the authentication token most recently received from the Raven server.
